title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - 7.6, Galio rework
body:
"Minions" art created by inkinesss

Hey guys! Welcome to Patch Chat, a Dev Corner thread we make to talk about our new patches every two weeks: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-76-notes

I'm Aesah on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of Diamond+ players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to LoL in terms of both balance and fun. We'll be watching this thread to answer as many questions as we can.

Apart from the long-awaited Galio rework, 7.6 is a relatively smaller patch. Warlord's Bloodlust has been rebalanced to be better against tanks. Some champions that recieved buffs include Aatrox, Fiddlesticks, Cho'gath, Gnar, Varus and Miss Fortune while on the other end Quinn was nerfed. 

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

i don't know. How many damage characters are too many? and how many tanks are too many? how many are just enough? also just because someone can heal due to items and masteries doesn't mean much. You really are complaining because the game has a very small amount of dedicated healer champions? in a game with over 120 champions? People like different playstyles, some like to roam, some like to be tanks, some like to splitpush to no end, some like to heal, some like to peel, some like do insane damage. There is never "too many" of a certain role as long as those champions in that role do something relatively unique from each other. Whether that means having something the others don't, or being more of a generalist than the others, or just specializing in something the others don't. Champions don't need 100% unique kits, you can make champions with almost identical kits but just having one aspect while the other on another aspect will make it distinct enough.

I personally enjoy playing healers and a lot of people who play and main support also enjoy playing them and all of them kit wise are very distinct. Items on the other hand are something that seriously needs to be looked at so that supports don't build the exact same thing regardless of whether they are a healer, peeler, frontliner, etc etc

Hey guys!

Loving the feel of the Galio rework so far, but I was wondering about a strange interaction: the unexpected outcome that happens if you cast Galio's ultimate while out of range of an ally.

The *expected* behavior was that you'd approach and, as soon as you're in range, you'd fly to the position the ally was when you entered the range. I was surprised to find that this isn't the case: you seem to fly to whatever position the ally was when you *initially* targeted the ability from outside the cast range, even if you and they have both walked halfway across the map to get there. This seems potentially awful in situations where a Galio is trying to take the shortest route to save an ally and has simply hit the button and then shifted to watch the developing fight, hoping he gets there in time. It's very unexpected, especially since they don't gain the defenses until you're in range, suggesting that the spell hasn't actually been cast.

Is this intentional behavior? Because it feels REALLY off, and I'm curious if you encountered this in playtesting.

...although I'm sure you can do some crazy plays with this if you plan for it.
That just sounds like a bug to me, will look into it

Hey Rob, long long time sub how do you like playtest team compared to LCS?
It's a lot more relaxed and personally enjoy working with talented people at Riot.  Of course, sometimes I miss being on the big stage, but didn't enjoy the amount of time spent practicing.

Are you guys working on another song for an upcoming champion? I really enjoyed 'Get Jinxed' and 'Here comes Vi.' They inspired me to write original songs for other champions that I perform during karaoke nights for my family and friends.

Which lane does Galio preform the best? It seems he's not an optimal mid laner. Top lane makes the most amount of sense, but I feel you wouldn't make the most out of your ult there. I doubt Galio can clear jg very well, although his ganks would be fantastic. Support seems to be a viable choice.

When thinking about Galio the question isn't "is he better top or mid?" it's "is a team with Galio top and a standard mid more successful?". So IMO he performs individually the best mid, but fills out most teamcomps better as a top laner so he may have a higher winrate there.
